security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with guidelines and templates for creating SKILL.md files. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or filesystem access. All code examples are in markdown documentation blocks for educational purposes only.

content.value_statement: Creating effective SKILL.md files helps Claude understand when and how to use your skill. This guide provides best practices for naming, structure, and content organization so your skills are easy to discover and execute.
actual_capabilities: Guides naming conventions and description standards for skills
Explains YAML frontmatter requirements and field specifications
Provides templates for basic and workflow-style skills
Shows examples of good and bad skill files with improvements
Covers quality checklists and content organization guidelines
Includes troubleshooting advice and FAQ sections
limitations: Does not execute code or create files directly
Does not integrate with external APIs or services
Does not perform validation on existing skill files
Does not provide automated testing for skills

use_cases.title: New Skill Creation
use_cases.description: Use templates and examples to create your first Claude skill with proper structure.

use_cases.title: Improve Existing Skills
use_cases.description: Refactor poorly written skills using the bad-example guide with specific improvements.

use_cases.title: Establish Skill Standards
use_cases.description: Define team conventions for skill authoring with the quality checklist and best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the basic-skill-template to create a SKILL.md for a skill that [describe what your skill does].

prompt_templates.title: Create Workflow Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the workflow-skill-template to document a skill that handles [describe the workflow process] with decision points.

prompt_templates.title: Review Skill Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the SKILL.md file at [path] against the quality checklist in create-skill-file and suggest specific improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Fix Naming Issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the naming conventions in create-skill-file and suggest better names for skills with these current names: [list names].

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill that processes CSV files and generates summary reports
output: I can help you create a CSV processing skill using the basic-skill-template structure.
First, let me outline what your skill needs:
‚Ä¢ Name: Use verb-noun format like 'processing-csv-files' or 'generating-csv-reports'
‚Ä¢ Description: Include trigger keywords like 'CSV', 'process', 'generate report', 'data analysis'
‚Ä¢ When to Use: List 4-5 specific scenarios when users would need this skill
‚Ä¢ How It Works: Provide 3-4 clear steps that Claude follows
‚Ä¢ Examples: Show 2 complete input-output examples with expected results
Would you like me to draft the full SKILL.md using the template?

best_practices: Use specific, descriptive names with verb-noun format (e.g., 'processing-csv-files' not 'helper')
Include trigger keywords and scenarios in the description to help Claude activate correctly
Keep content concise and focused on information Claude does not already know
Provide executable commands and real code examples rather than abstract descriptions
anti_patterns: Using generic names like 'helper' or 'utility' that do not describe specific functionality
Including general programming knowledge that Claude already knows
Writing tutorial-style content instead of actionable work instructions
Omitting error handling guidance or verification steps for success

faq.question: What is the ideal length for a SKILL.md file?
faq.answer: Keep SKILL.md between 200-500 lines. If longer, split into reference sub-files with the main file under 500 lines.

faq.question: What fields are required in the YAML frontmatter?
faq.answer: Only 'name' and 'description' are required. Name must be lowercase with hyphens. Description should include trigger keywords.

faq.question: How do I make my skill easier to activate?
faq.answer: Use specific keywords in the description that users would naturally say. List 3-5 trigger scenarios in the 'When to Use' section.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads documentation files. It does not execute code, access files outside its directory, or send data anywhere.

faq.question: Why is my skill not activating?
faq.answer: Check that your skill name matches the directory name. Ensure the description includes keywords users would actually type. Verify the skill file is in the correct location.

faq.question: How is this different from system prompts?
faq.answer: Skills are modular, reusable knowledge files. Unlike one-off prompts, skills can be shared across projects and activated automatically based on description keywords.
